替.definition: to substitute for; to take the place of; to replace; for; on behalf of; to stand in for

替代.definition: to substitute for; to replace; to supersede

替古人擔憂.definition: to fret over the worries of long-departed people (idiom); to worry unnecessarily; crying over spilt milk; often used with negatives, e.g. no need to worry about past issues

替古人耽憂.definition: to fret over the worries of long-departed people (idiom); to worry unnecessarily; crying over spilt milk; often used with negatives, e.g. no need to worry about past issues

替換.definition: to exchange; to replace; to substitute for; to switch

替班.definition: to act as substitute; to fill in for sb

替班兒.definition: erhua variant of 替班[ti4 ban1]

替罪.definition: to take the rap for sb

替罪羔羊.definition: scapegoat; sacrificial lamb; same as 替罪羊

替補.definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc); a substitute; a replacement

替角兒.definition: erhua variant of 替角[ti4 jue2]

替身.definition: stand-in; substitute; body double; stuntman; scapegoat; fall guy; to stand in for sb else

替身演員.definition: substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts); stuntman
